  • Element
org.apache.juneau.http.remote

Annotation Type Remote


  • @Documented
 @Target(value=TYPE)
 @Retention(value=RUNTIME)
 @Inherited
public @interface Remote
    Identifies a proxy against a REST interface.
    • Overview > juneau-rest-client > REST Proxies

    • Optional Element Summary

      Optional Elements 
      Modifier and Type Optional Element and Description
      String[] headers
      Default request headers.
      Class<? extends HeaderSupplier> headerSupplier
      Default request header supplier.
      String path
      REST service path.
      String version
      Specifies the client version of this interface.
      String versionHeader
      Specifies the client version header name.

    • Element Detail

      • path

        public abstract String path
        REST service path.

        The possible values are:

        • An absolute URL.
        • A relative URL interpreted as relative to the root URL defined on the RestClient
        • No path interpreted as the class name (e.g. "http://localhost/root-url/org.foo.MyInterface")
        • Supports Overview > juneau-marshall > Simple Variable Language > VarResolver.DEFAULT (e.g. "$P{mySystemProperty}").
        Default:
        ""

      • headers

        public abstract String[] headers
        Default request headers.

        Specifies headers to set on all requests.

        • Supports Overview > juneau-marshall > Simple Variable Language > VarResolver.DEFAULT (e.g. "$P{mySystemProperty}").
        Default:
        {}

      • headerSupplier

        public abstract Class<? extends HeaderSupplier> headerSupplier
        Default request header supplier.

        Specifies a dynamic supplier of headers to set on all requests.

        • Supplier class must provide a public no-arg constructor.
        Default:
        org.apache.juneau.http.HeaderSupplier.Null.class

      • version

        public abstract String version
        Specifies the client version of this interface.

        Used to populate the "X-Client-Version" header that identifies what version of client this is so that the server side can handle older versions accordingly.

        The format of this is a string of the format #[.#[.#[...]] (e.g. "1.2.3").

        The server side then uses an OSGi-version matching pattern to identify which methods to call:

        // Call this method if X-Client-Version is at least 2.0. // Note that this also matches 2.0.1. @RestMethod(name=GET, path="/foobar", clientVersion="2.0") public Object method1() {...} // Call this method if X-Client-Version is at least 1.1, but less than 2.0. @RestMethod(name=GET, path="/foobar", clientVersion="[1.1,2.0)") public Object method2() {...} // Call this method if X-Client-Version is less than 1.1. @RestMethod(name=GET, path="/foobar", clientVersion="[0,1.1)") public Object method3() {...}

        • Supports Overview > juneau-marshall > Simple Variable Language > VarResolver.DEFAULT (e.g. "$P{mySystemProperty}").
        Default:
        ""

      • versionHeader

        public abstract String versionHeader
        Specifies the client version header name.

        The default value is "X-Client-Version".

        • Supports Overview > juneau-marshall > Simple Variable Language > VarResolver.DEFAULT (e.g. "$P{mySystemProperty}").
        Default:
        ""
